_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  The butane blending system was engineered and constructed to meet the NFPA #58 1998 Edition.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Detroit Fire Department (Station #48 is the initial responder) as well as the Wayne County Department of Homeland Security and Emergency Management, as necessary.  Medical emergencies will require notification to the local (EMS out of Station #48) Emergency Management Services and Oakwood Hospital.  This facility maintains a trained incipient fire response and hazardous materials response team (Technician Level) to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.  Additional hazmat capabilities are provided by Detroit's HazMat Unit 56.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal is a bulk refined petroleum storage facility, including butane blending operations.  The Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one storage vessel.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system's vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed by the system (85%) automatic shutoff resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The facility's alternate release scenario (potential for off-site impacts) is a BLEVE.  Both scenarios, although extremely unlikely, have the potential for the distance to endpoint to extend off-site and affect both public and environmental receptors.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the 14 elements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119), and all applicable state and lo

cal laws and regulations.  This butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 (1998) and the manufacturer's (Texon, LP) instructions.  The system is currently approved for operation by the State/Local Fire Marshal.



To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Detroit Fire Department (initial response is expected to be from Station #48) and request their assistance.  The facility maintains a trained incipient fire response and hazardous materials response team.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the Wayne County LEPC/Department of Homeland Security and Emergency Management.  The Detroit Fire Department has participates in the RMP/PSM training session and response exercises for this system.



Buckeye Terminals, LLC continually evaluates this process for opportunities to improve safety.  Continued facilitation of Terminal and Fire Department interaction is a priority of this Facility.
